ramble.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to talk for a long time in a way that does not seem clearly organized, so that other people find it difficult to understand you
ramble.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She’s getting old and she tends to ramble a bit.
ramble.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to go on a walk in the countryside for pleasure
ramble.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: There’s plenty to discover as you ramble around this little island.
ramble.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a plant that rambles grows in all directions
ramble.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a walk in the countryside for pleasure
ramble.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: I quite like the idea of going for a ramble one weekend.
ramble.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a speech or piece of writing that is very long and does not seem to be clearly organized
ramble.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: In a ten-page ramble, Barre explains why he wrote the book.
